bit_ranges.name: not_used
bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and 
ignore read value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.name: Vendor_ID_VID
bit_ranges.description:
A unique 16-bit unsigned integer. 
Assigned by the USB-IF to the 
Vendor.

bit_ranges.name: not_used
bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and 
ignore read value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.name: USB_Product_ID_PID
bit_ranges.description:
A unique 16-bit unsigned integer. 
Assigned uniquely by the Vendor to 
identify the TCPC.

bit_ranges.name: not_used
bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and 
ignore read value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.name: bcdDevice
bit_ranges.description:
A unique 16-bit unsigned integer. 
Assigned by the Vendor to identify 
the version of the TCPC.

bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and 
ignore read value. Always reads0.

Reserved. Always write as 0 and 
ignore read value. Always reads0.

Version number assigned by 
USB-IF (Currently at Revision 
1.1 - 00010001)

ignore read value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.description: 0010 0000 - Revision2.0

ignore 
read 
value. 
Always 
reads0.

release)

0001 0001 
- 
Version 
1.1 Etc.

Not used. Always write as 0 and ignore 
read value.

bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. Always write as 0 and ignore 
read value.

bit_ranges.name: VBUS_Sink_Disconnect_Detected
bit_ranges.description:
0b:Cleared 
1b: A Vbus Sink Disconnect Threshold 
crossing has been detected

bit_ranges.name: Rx_Buffer_Overflow
bit_ranges.description:
0b: 
TCPC 
Rx 
buffer 
is 
functioning properly 1b: TCPC 
Rx buffer has overflowed 
Writing 1 to this register acknowledges 
the overflow. The overflow is cleared by 
writing to ALERT.RecevieSOP* Message 
Status

bit_ranges.name: Fault
bit_ranges.description:
0b: No Fault 
1b: An Fault has occurred. 
Read 
the 
FAULT_STATUS 
register

bit_ranges.name: VBUS_Voltage_Alarm_Lo
bit_ranges.description:
0b:Cleared 
1b: A low-voltage alarm has occurred

bit_ranges.name: VBUS_Voltage_Alarm_Hi
bit_ranges.description:
0b:Cleared 
1b: A high-voltage alarm has occurred

bit_ranges.name: Transmit_SOP_Message_successful
bit_ranges.description:
0b:Cleared, 
1b: 
Reset 
or 
SOP* 
message 
transmission 
successful. 
GoodCRC 
response 
received on SOP* message 
transmission. Transmit SOP* message 
buffer registers are empty.

bit_ranges.name: Transmit_SOP_Message_discarded
bit_ranges.description:
0b:Cleared, 
1b: 
Reset 
or 
SOP* 
message 
transmission not sent due to incoming 
receive message. 
Transmit 
SOP* 
message buffer registers are empty.

bit_ranges.name: Transmit_SOP_Message_failed
bit_ranges.description:
0b:Cleared, 
1b: SOP* message transmission not 
successful, 
no 
GoodCRC 
response 
received 
on 
SOP* 
message 
transmission. Transmit SOP* message 
buffer registers are empty.

bit_ranges.name: Received_Hard_Reset
bit_ranges.description:
0b:Cleared, 
1b: Received Hard Reset message 
Note: The TCPM is not expected to 
mask the ’’Received Hard Reset’’ 
alert bit.

bit_ranges.name: Receive_SOP_Message_Status
bit_ranges.description:
0b:Cleared, 
1b: RECEIVE_BUFFER register changed. 
RECEIVE_BYTE_COUNT being set to 0 
does not set this bit.

bit_ranges.name: Port_Power_Status
bit_ranges.description: 0b: Cleared, 1b: Port status changed

bit_ranges.name: CC_Status
bit_ranges.description: 0b: Cleared, 1b: CC status changed

bit_ranges.name: not_used
bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value.

bit_ranges.name: High_Impedance_outputs
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Standard output control (default) 
1b: 
Force 
all 
outputs 
to 
high 
impedance May be used to save power 
in Sleep Controlled by the TCPM.

bit_ranges.name: Debug_Accessory_Connected
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Debug Accessory Connected# output 
driven 
low 1b: Debug Accessory Connected# 
output is driven high(default) 
Controlled by either the TCPM or TCPC. The 
TCPC 
shall 
ignore writes 
to 
this 
bit 
if 
TCPC_CONTROL.DebugAccessoryControl =0b.

bit_ranges.name: Audio_Accessory_Connected
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Audio Accessory connected 
1b: 
No 
Audio 
Accessory 
connected(default) 
Controlled 
by 
the 
TCPM

bit_ranges.name: Active_Cable_Connected
bit_ranges.description:
0b: 
No 
Active 
Cable 
connected 
(default) 1b: Active Cable connected 
Controlled by the TCPM

bit_ranges.name: MUX_Control
bit_ranges.description:
00b: No connection (default) 
01b: USB3.1Connected 
10b: DP Alternate Mode - 4lanes 
11b: USB3.1 + Display Port Lanes 0 & 
1 Controlled by the TCPM

bit_ranges.name: Connection_Present
bit_ranges.description:
0b: No Connection (default) 
1b:Connection 
Controlled by the TCPM.

bit_ranges.name: Connector_Orientation
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Normal (CC1=A5, CC2=B5,TX1=A2/A3, 
RX1=B10/B11)default 
1b: 
Flipped 
(CC2=A5, 
CC1=B5,TX1=B2/B3, RX1=A10/A11) 
Controlled by the TCPM 
The TCPC shall ignore writes to this bit if 
TCPC_CONTROL.DebugAccessoryControl =0

bit_ranges.name: not_used
bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value.

bit_ranges.name: Reserved
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value.

bit_ranges.name: Debug_Accessory_Control
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Controlled by TCPC (power on default) 
1b: Controlled by TCPM. The TCPM writes 1b 
to 
this 
register 
to 
take over control of 
asserting the DebugAccessoryConnected#. 
Required 
(Register 
is 
required 
but 
output is not required)

bit_ranges.name: Reserved32
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value.

bit_ranges.name: BIST_Test_Mode
bit_ranges.description:
Setting this bit to 1 is intended to be used 
only when a USB compliance tester is using 
USB BIST Test Data to test the PHY layer of 
the TCPC. The TCPM should clear it when a 
detach is detected. 
0: Normal Operation. Incoming messages 
enabled by RECEIVE_DETECT passed to TCPM 
via Alert. 
1: BIST Test Mode. 
Incoming messages 
enabled 
by 
RECEIVE_DETECT 
result 
in 
GoodCRC response but may not be passed to 
the TCPM via Alert. TCPC may temporarily 
store 
incoming messages 
in 
the Receive 
Message Buffer, but this may or may not 
result in a Receive SOP* Message Status or a 
Rx Buffer Overflow alert. 
The TCPM can mask or 
ignore 
received 
message alerts when this bit is set to 1 since 
the TCPC may or may not assert the alert. 
The TCPM may also treat received messages 
in this mode in the same way as received 
messages during normal operation.

bit_ranges.name: Plug_Orientation
bit_ranges.description:
0b: When Vconn is enabled, apply it to the 
CC2 pin. Monitor 
the CC1 pin 
for BMC 
communications if PD messaging is enabled. 
1b: When Vconn is enabled, apply it to the 
CC1pin. Monitor 
the CC2 pin 
for BMC 
communications if PD messaging is enabled. 
Required

bit_ranges.name: Reserved
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value.

bit_ranges.name: DRP
bit_ranges.description:
0b: No DRP. Bits B3..0 determine Rp/Rd/Ra or 
open settings 
1b:DRP 
The TCPC shall use the Rp value defined 
inB5..4 when a connection is resolved, ie. 
Upon entry to Potential_Connect_as_Src in 
Figure 4-11. TCPC State Machine before a 
Connection. 
The TCPC toggles CC1 & CC2 after receiving 
COMMAND.Look4Connection 
and 
until 
connection 
is detected. Upon connection, 
the 
TCPC shall resolve to either an Rp or Rd and 
report the CC1/CC2 State 
in the CC_STATUS 
register. 
The 
CC 
pins 
shall 
stay 
in 
Potential_start_as_SRC 
or 
Potential_start_as_Sink 
until 
directedotherwise.

bit_ranges.name: Rp_Value
bit_ranges.description:
00b: 
Rp 
default 
01b: Rp1.5A 
10b: Rp3.0A 
11b:Reserved

bit_ranges.name: CC2
bit_ranges.description:
00b:Ra 
01b: Rp 
(Use Rp definition 
in 
B5..4) 10b:Rd 
11b: Open (Disconnect or don’t care)

bit_ranges.name: CC1
bit_ranges.description:
00b:Ra 
01b: Rp 
(Use Rp definition 
in 
B5..4) 10b:Rd 
11b: Open (Disconnect or don’t care)

bit_ranges.name: not_used
bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value.

bit_ranges.name: Reserved
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value.

bit_ranges.name: Force_Off_VBUS_Source_or_Sink
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Allow STANDARD INPUT SIGNAL Force Off 
Vbus control(default) 
1b: Block STANDARD INPUT SIGNAL Force Off 
Vbus control 
This enables or disables 
the STANDARD 
INPUT 
SIGNAL 
Force 
Off 
Vbus 
(4.5.1) 
functionality for debug purposes. 
Required 
if 
STANDARD_INPUT_CAPABILITES.ForceOff 
VBUS

bit_ranges.name: VBUS_Discharge_Fault_Detection_Timer
bit_ranges.description:
0b: VBUS Discharge Fault Detection Timer 
enabled 1b: VBUS Discharge Fault Detection 
Timer disabled This enables the timers for 
both 
FAULT_STATUTS.AutoDischargeFailed 
and FAULT_STATUS.ForceDischargeFailed 
Required

bit_ranges.name: Internal_or_External_OCP_VBUS_Over_Current_Protection_Fault
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Internal and External OCP circuit 
enabled 1b: Internal and External OCP 
circuit disabled Required if 
DEVICE_CAPABILIITES_1.VBUSOCPReporting 
=1b

bit_ranges.name: Internal_or_External_OVP_VBUS_Over_Voltage_Protection_Fault
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Internal and External OVP circuit 
enabled 1b: Internal and External OVP 
circuit disabled Required if 
DEVICE_CAPABILIITES_1.VBUSOVPReporting 
=1b

bit_ranges.name: VCONN_Over_Current_Fault
bit_ranges.description:
0b: 
Fault 
detection 
circuit 
enabled 1b: 
Fault detection 
circuit disabled Required if 
DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_2.VCONNOvercurrent
FaultCapable =1b

bit_ranges.name: not_used
bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value.

bit_ranges.name: Reserved
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. 
Always 
write 
as 
0 
and 
ignore 
readvalue.

bit_ranges.name: VBUS_VOLTAGE_Monitor
bit_ranges.description:
0b: 
VBUS_VOLTAGE Monitoring 
is 
enabled 
(default) 
1b: VBUS_VOLTAGE Monitoring 
is 
disabled 
Controls 
only 
VBUS_VOLTAGE 
Monitoring. 
VBUS_VOLTAGE shall report all zeros if disabled. 
Required 
DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_1.VBUSMeasurementandA
larmCapable =1b

bit_ranges.name: Disable_Voltage_Alarms
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Voltage Alarms Power status reporting is 
enabled (default) 
1b: Voltage Alarms Power status reporting 
is 
disabled 
Controls 
VBUS_VOLTAGE_ALARM_HI_CFG 
and 
VBUS_VOLTAGE_ALARM_LO_CFG. 
Required 
DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_1.VBUSMeasurementandA
larmCapable =1b

bit_ranges.name: AutoDischargeDisconnect
bit_ranges.description:
0b: The TCPC shall not automatically discharge 
VBUS based on VBUS voltage. 
1b: The TCPC 
shall 
automatically discharge 
(default) 
Refer 
to 
4.4.5.4.1 
and 
4.4.5.4.2. 
Strength of discharge set by tAutoDischarge in 
Table4-18 
Setting 
this bit 
in 
a Source TCPC 
triggers 
thefollowing actions upon disconnection detection: 
1. Disable sourcing power over VBUS 
2. VBUS discharge 
Sourcing power over VBUS shall be disabled 
before or at same time as starting VBUS discharge. 
Setting this bit in a Sink TCPC triggers the 
following action upon disconnection detection: 
1. VBUS discharge 
The TCPC shall automatically disable discharge 
once the voltage on VBUS is below vSafe0V (max) 
or VBUS_STOP_DISCHARGE_THRESHOLD. 
Disconnect detection is defined in Figure 4-
12. 
VBUS_STOP_DISCHARGE_THRESHOLD,if 
enabled, 
takes 
priority 
over 
vSafe0V. 
Required

bit_ranges.name: Enable_Bleed_Discharge
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Disable bleed discharge(default) 
1b: Enable bleed discharge of VBUS 
Bleed Discharge is a low current discharge to 
provide a minimum load current if needed 
10K Ohms or 2mArecommended 
Required if 
DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_1.BleedDischarge =1b

bit_ranges.name: Force_Discharge
bit_ranges.description:
0b: 
Disable 
forced 
discharge 
(default) 1b: Enable forced discharge 
of VBUS. Required if 
DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_1.ForceDischarge =1b

bit_ranges.name: not_used
bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.name: Reserved
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.name: Looking4Connection
bit_ranges.description:
0b: TCPC is not actively looking for a connection. A 
transition 
from 
’1’ 
to 
’0’ 
indicates a potential 
connection has been found. 
1b: TCPC is looking for a connection (toggling as 
a DRP or looking for a connection as Sink/Source 
only condition)

bit_ranges.name: ConnectResult
bit_ranges.description:
0b: the TCPC is presenting Rp 1b: 
the TCPC is presenting Rd

bit_ranges.name: CC2_State
bit_ranges.description:
If 
(ROLE_CONTROL.CC2=Rp) 
or 
(ConnectResult=0) 00b: SRC.Open (Open,Rp) 
01b: SRC.Ra (below maximumvRa) 
10b: SRC.Rd (within the vRd range) 
11b:reserved 
 
If 
(ROLE_CONTROL.CC2=Rd) 
or 
(ConnectResult=1) 
00b: 
SNK.Open 
(Below 
maximumvRa) 
01b: SNK.Default (Above minimum vRd-Connect) 
10b: 
SNK.Power1.5 
(Above minimum 
vRd-
Connect) Detects Rp1.5A 
11b: 
SNK.Power3.0 
(Above minimum 
vRd-
Connect) Detects Rp3.0A 
 
If ROLE_CONTROL.CC2=Ra, this field is set to00b 
If ROLE_CONTROL.CC2=Open, this field is set to00b 
 
This 
field 
always 
returns 
00b 
if 
(Looking4Connection=1) 
or 
(POWER_CONTROL.EnableVconn=1 
and 
POWER_CONTROL.PlugOrientation=0). 
Otherwise, the returned value depends upon 
ROLE_CONTROL.CC2.

bit_ranges.name: CC1_State
bit_ranges.description:
If (ROLE_CONTROL.CC1 = Rp)or 
(ConnectResult=0) 
00b: SRC.Open (Open,Rp) 
01b: SRC.Ra (below maximumvRa) 
10b: SRC.Rd (within the vRd range) 
11b:reserved 
 
If 
(ROLE_CONTROL.CC1 
= 
Rd) 
(ConnectResult=1) 
00b: 
SNK.Open 
(Below 
maximumvRa) 
01b: SNK.Default (Above minimum vRd-Connect) 
10b: 
SNK.Power1.5 
(Above minimum 
vRd-
Connect) DetectsRp-1.5A 
11b: 
SNK.Power3.0 
(Above minimum 
vRd-
Connect) DetectsRp-3.0A 
 
If ROLE_CONTROL.CC1=Ra, this field is set to00b 
If ROLE_CONTROL.CC1=Open, this field is set to00b 
 
This 
field 
always 
returns 
00b 
if 
(Looking4Connection=1) 
or 
(POWER_CONTROL.EnableVconn=1 
and 
POWER_CONTROL.PlugOrientation=0). 
Otherwise, the returned value depends upon 
ROLE_CONTROL.CC1.

bit_ranges.name: not_used
bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.name: Debug_Accessory_Connected
bit_ranges.description:
0b: 
No 
Debug 
Accessory 
connected 
(default) 1b: Debug Accessoryconnected 
Reflects 
the 
state 
of 
theDebugAccessoryConnected# 
output 
if 
supported Required 
(Register 
is 
required but 
output is not required)

bit_ranges.name: TCPC_Initialization_Status
bit_ranges.description:
0b: The TCPC has completed initialization and 
all registers are valid 
1b: 
The 
TCPC 
is 
still 
performing 
internal 
initialization and 
the only 
registers 
that are 
guaranteed 
to 
return 
the 
correct values are 
00h..0Fh.  
Required

bit_ranges.name: Sourcing_High_Voltage
bit_ranges.description:
0b:vSafe5V 
1b: HighVoltage 
This does not control the path, just provides a 
monitor of the status. Assert as long as supplying 
voltage greater than vSafe5V. 
Required if voltage higher than vSafe5V can 
be sourced

bit_ranges.name: Sourcing_VBUS
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Sourcing Vbus is disabled 
1b: Sourcing Vbus is enabled 
This does not control the path, just provides a 
monitor of the status. 
Required

bit_ranges.name: VBUS_Present_Detection_Enabled
bit_ranges.description:
0b: VBUS Present Detection Disabled 
1b: VBUS Present Detection Enabled (default) 
Indicates 
if the TCPC 
is monitoring 
for VBUS 
Present or if the circuit has been powered off. 
Required

bit_ranges.name: VBUS_Present
bit_ranges.description:
0b: 
VBUS 
Disconnected 
1b: VBUSConnected 
The TCPC shall report VBUS present when TCPC 
detects VBUS rises above 4V. The TCPC shall 
report VBUS is not present when TCPC detects 
VBUS falls below 3.5V. The TCPC may report 
VBUS is not present if VBUS is between 3.5V 
and4V. 
Required

bit_ranges.name: VCONN_Present
bit_ranges.description:
0b: VCONN is not present 
1b: This bit is asserted when VCONN is enabled 
for CC1 or CC2. Measurement of board-level 
VCONN supply is not supported. 
If POWER_CONTROL.EnableVCONN is disabled 
VCONN Present will be set to0b. 
Required

bit_ranges.name: Sink_VBUS
bit_ranges.description:
0b: Sink is Disconnected (Default and if 
not supported) 
1b: TCPC is sinking VBUS to the system 
load Required

bit_ranges.name: Reserved
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. Always write as 0 and ignore read 
value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.name: Force_Off_VBUS_Source_or_Sink
bit_ranges.description:
0b: No Fault Detected, no action (default 
and not supported) 
1b: VBUS Source/Sink has been forced off 
due to external fault 
The TCPC has disconnected VBUS due 
to STANDARD_INPUT.ForceOffVbus. 
Required 
if 
STANDARD_INPUT_CAPABILITIES_1.ForceOffV
bus 
=1b

bit_ranges.name: Auto_Discharge_Failed
bit_ranges.description:
0b: No dischargefailure 
1b: Discharge commanded by the TCPMfailed 
If 
POWER_CONTROL.AutoDischargeDisconnect 
is set, the TCPC shall report discharge fails if 
VBUS is not below vSafe0V withintSafe0V. 
Required

bit_ranges.name: Force_Discharge_Failed
bit_ranges.description:
0b: No dischargefailure 
1b: Discharge commanded by the TCPMfailed 
If POWER_CONTROL.ForceDischarge is set, 
the TCPC shall report a discharge fails if 
VBUS is not below vSafe0V withintSafe0V. 
Required 
if 
DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_1.ForceDischarge=
1b

bit_ranges.description:
0b: 
Not 
in 
an 
over-current 
protectionstate 
1b: 
Over-current 
faultlatched 
Required 
if 
DEVICE_CAPABILIITES_1.VBUSOCPReportin
g= 
1b

bit_ranges.description:

bit_ranges.description:

1b: Over 
current VCONN 
fault 
latched Requiredif 
DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_2.VCONNOvercurrentF
ault Capable =1b

bit_ranges.name: Interface_Error
bit_ranges.description:
0b: NoError 
1b: Error hasoccurred. 
A TRANSMIT has been sent with an 
empty TRANSMIT_BUFFER. 
May be asserted if a non-zero value has been 
written to a reserved bit in aregister. 
Required

bit_ranges.name: not_used
bit_ranges.description:
Not used. Always write as 0 and 
ignore 
readvalue.

bit_ranges.name: Command
bit_ranges.description:
0001 0001b Wake Interface (no action 
is 
taken other than to wake the interface). 
0010 0010b DisableVbusDetect. Disable Vbus 
present detection. The TCPC shall ignore this 
command 
and 
assert 
the 
FAULT_STATUS.InterfaceError if it has sourcing 
or sinking power over Vbus enabled. 
0011 0011b EnableVbusDetect. Enable Vbus 
present detection. 
0100 0100b DisableSinkVbus. Disable sinking 
power over Vbus. This COMMAND does not 
disable 
POWER_STATUS.VBUSPresent 
detection. 
TheTCPC 
shall 
clear 
FAULT_STATUS.InternalorExternalOCP 
andFAULT_STATUS.InternalorExternalOVP. 
0101 0101b SinkVbus. Enable sinking power 
over Vbus and enable Vbus present detection. 
The TCPC shall 
ignore 
this command and 
assert the FAULT_STATUS.InterfaceError if it 
has sourcing power over Vbus enabled. 
0110 
0110b DisableSourceVbus. Disable 
sourcing power over Vbus. The TCPC shall 
stop reporting FAULT_STATUS. Internal or 
External OCP or OVP Faults. This COMMAND 
does 
not 
disable 
POWER_STATUS.VBUSPresentdetection. 
0111 0111b SourceVbusDefaultVoltage. Enable 
sourcing vSafe5V over Vbus and enable Vbus 
present detection. Source shall transition to 
vSafe5V if at a high voltage. The TCPC shall 
ignore 
this 
command 
and 
assert 
the 
FAULT_STATUS.InterfaceError if it has sinking
power over Vbus enabled. 
1000 1000b SourceVbusHighVoltage. Execute 
sourcing high voltage over Vbus. The TCPC shall 
ignore 
this 
command 
and 
assert 
the 
FAULT_STATUS.InterfaceError if it is currently 
sinking voltage from Vbus or does not have 
ability to source voltages higher than vSafe5V. 
The TCPC shall ignore this command and assert 
the FAULT_STATUS.InterfaceError if not already 
sourcing vSafe5V. The actual voltage to be 
sourced may be set in a vendor defined manner. 
The TCPM may need to send vendor defined 
commands before sending this COMMAND. 
1001 
1001b 
Look4Connection. Start DRP 
Toggling if ROLE_CONTROL.DRP=1b.If 
ROLE_CONTROL.CC1/CC2=01b start with Rp, if 
ROLE_CONTROL.CC1/CC2=10b start with Rd. 
If ROLE_CONTROL.CC1/CC2 are not 01b or 
10b, then do not start toggling. The TCPM shall 
issue COMMAND.Look4Connection 
to enable 
the TCPCto restart Connection Detection 
in 
cases where the ROLE_CONTROL contents will 
not change. An example of this is when a 
potential connection as a Source occurred but 
was further debounced by the TCPM to find the 
Sink disconnected. In this case a Source Only 
or DRP should go back to its Unattached.Src 
state. This would result 
in ROLE_CONTROL 
staying the same. TCPC to  
MAINTAIN_STATE in Figure4-11 
1010 
1010b 
RxOneMore. 
Configure 
the 
receiver 
to 
automatically 
clear 
the 
RECEIVE_DETECT register after sending the 
next GoodCRC. This 
is used 
to shutdown 
reception 
of 
packets 
at 
a 
known 
point 
regardless of packet separation or the depth 
of the receive FIFO in the TCPC. 
1100 
1100b 
Reserved. 
No 
Action  
1101 
1101b 
Reserved. 
No 
Action  
1110 
1110b 
Reserved. 
NoAction 
1111 0000b Enable 1st VBUS source (sets bit 
[0] of vbus_source_en output when VBUS 
sourcing is activated and clear all others).
1111 0001b Enable 2nd VBUS source (sets bit 
[1] of vbus_source_en output when VBUS 
sourcing is activated and clear all others). 
1111 0010b Enable 3rd VBUS source (sets bit 
[2] of vbus_source_en output when vbus 
sourcing is activated and clear all others). 
1111 0011b Enable 4th VBUS source (sets bit 
[3] of vbus_source_en output when VBUS 
sourcing is activated and clear all others). 
1111 1111b Reserved. NoAction

mer,

VBUS 
voltage measurement 
nor

bit_ranges.description:
00b: Rp default 
only. 
01b: Rp 1.5A and default. 
10b: Rp 3.0A, 1.5A, and 
default.11b:Reserved. 
Rp values which may be configured by the 
TCPM via the ROLE_CONTROL register

bit_ranges.name: Roles_Supported
bit_ranges.description:
000b: 
USB 
Type-C 
Port Manager 
can 
configure the Port as Source only or Sink only 
(not DRP). 001b: Source only. 010b: Sink 
only. 011b: Sink with accessory support. 
100b: DRP only. 101b: Source, Sink, DRP, 
Adapter/Cable all supported. 110b: Source, 
Sink, DRP. 111b: Not valid

All 
SOP* 
except

bit_ranges.description:
00: TCPC has 25mV LSB for its voltage 
alarm 
and 
uses 
all 
10 
bits 
in 
VBUS_VOLTAGE_ALARM_HI_CFG 
and 
VBUS_VOLTAGE_ALARM_LO_CFG. 
01: TCPC has 50mV LSB for its voltage 
alarm and uses only 9bits. 
VBUS_VOLTAGE_ALARM_HI_CFG[0]and 
VBUS_VOLTAGE_ALARM_LO_CFG[0] 
are 
ignored by TCPC. 
10: TCPC has 100mV LSB for its voltage 
alarm and uses only 8bits. 
VBUS_VOLTAGE_ALARM_HI_CFG[1:0] and 
VBUS_VOLTAGE_ALARM_LO_CFG[1:0] 
are 
ignored by TCPC. 
11:reserved 
Support 
for 
VBUS_VOLTAGE_ALARM_LO_CFG 
and 
VBUS_VOLTAGE_ALARM_HI implemented

a

fault

t implemented

this register. This is the number of bytes 
in the RX_BUFFER_DATA_OBJECTS plus 
three (for the RX_BUF_FRAME_TYPE and 
RX_BUF_HEADER).

bit_ranges.name: Scale_Factor
bit_ranges.description:
00: VBUS measurement not 
scaled. 01: VBUS measurement 
divided by2 
10: VBUS measurement divided by4 
11: reserved. 
This 
field 
is 
fixed 
for 
any 
given 
configuration of the TCPC. Currently fixed 
at00.

bit_ranges.name: VBUS_voltage_measurement
bit_ranges.description:
10-bit measurement of (VBUS / ScaleFactor) 
TCPM multiplies this value by the scale factor 
to obtain the voltage measurement. Voltages 
greater than or equal to 4V shall meet +/- 2% 
absolute value or +/- 50mV, whichever is 
greater. The LSB is25mV. 
This 
register 
refreshes 
based 
on 
the 
vbus_voltage[9:0] input at an approximate 
rate of once every120us. 
It is therefore recommended that the register 
is read twice to obtain a stable value, with the 
interval 
between 
the 
reads 
greater 
than120us.

25mV LSB.(Default vSafe5V)

A value of B9:0=000h disables this 
threshold 
The TCPC may ignore B0 or B1 & B0 
depending upon 
DEVICE_CAPABILITIES_2.VbusVoltageAl
armLsb.

bit_ranges.name: PRESET_N_M
bit_ranges.description:
Value 
of 
this 
bit 
is 
presents 
preset_n_m output.

bit_ranges.name: Reserved3
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. Always write as 0 and ignore 
read value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.name: ALERT_CMN_READY
bit_ranges.description: When asserted TCPC PHY is ready

bit_ranges.name: ALERT_CMN_RESET_N
bit_ranges.description:
Value 
of 
this 
bit 
is 
presents 
cmn_reset_n output.

bit_ranges.name: ALERT_INIT
bit_ranges.description:
Controller 
initialization 
status: 
0b – TCPC initialized 
1b 
- 
TCPC 
being 
initialized 
- 
only 
SFRs[0..3] are readable. No SFR shall be 
written during initialization.

bit_ranges.name: ALERT_APB_BUSY
bit_ranges.description:
Last APB Slave transfer status. 
0b - processed. Ready for next transfer. 
1b - transfer pending. Next transfer will 
be postponed. Note: Read from the first 
4 SFR is never postponed.

bit_ranges.name: Reserved4
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. Always write as 0 and ignore 
read value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.name: ALERT_DP_HPD
bit_ranges.description:
State 
of 
Display 
Port 
HPD 
(source_hpd).

bit_ranges.name: ALERT_ALERT
bit_ranges.description:
State of alert_n pin. 
Default value is 1(inactive).

bit_ranges.name: CFG_STRAP
bit_ranges.description:
Value 
of 
Strap 
pins: 00b - do not 
advertise 01b 
- 
advertise as DFP 
10b 
- advertise 
as UFP 11b - start 
as DRP

bit_ranges.name: Reserved5
bit_ranges.description:
Reserved. Always write as 0 and ignore 
read value. Always reads0.

bit_ranges.name: PHY_RESET
bit_ranges.description:
0b - TCPC PD PHY layer reset 
deasserted 1b - TCPC PD PHY 
layer reset asserted

bit_ranges.name: CFG_SLEEP
bit_ranges.description:
0b - Xtensa is in sleep mode 
1b - Xtensa is not in sleep mode

bit_ranges.name: CFG_STALL
bit_ranges.description:
0b 
- 
Xtensa 
stall 
deasserted 
1b 
- 
Xtensa stall asserted 
Xtensa - RO, APB -
RW

bit_ranges.name: PWDATA_M_1
bit_ranges.description: Bits [15:8] of pwdata_m output.

bit_ranges.name: PWDATA_M_0
bit_ranges.description: Bits [7:0] of pwdata_m output.

bit_ranges.name: PADDR_M_1
bit_ranges.description: Bits [15:8] of paddr_m output.

bit_ranges.name: PADDR_M_0
bit_ranges.description: Bits [7:0] of paddr_m output.

bit_ranges.name: Reserved
bit_ranges.description:
This is a vendor defined capability. 
This part of register is reserved. These 
bits of register should not be accessed 
by software. It is described only for 
informative purposes.

bit_ranges.name: PRDATA_M_1
bit_ranges.description: Bits [15:8] of prdata_m input.

bit_ranges.name: PRDATA_M_0
bit_ranges.description: Bits [7:0] of prdata_m input.
